intro: Guindilia trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined guindilia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
